event.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners - electronic kitten EXPERIMENTAL WORKSHOP
event.subtitle: EXPERIMENTAL Day 1 - 20:00
event.description: Experimental new workshop - Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building an electronic touch-activated purring kitten. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 6 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

event.title: Arduino For Total Newbies
event.subtitle: Day 2
event.description:
''Learn Arduino using TV-B-Gone as an example project''

You've probably heard lots about '''Arduino'''. But if you don't know what it is, or how you can use it to do all sorts of cool things, then this fun and easy workshop is for you. As an example project, we'll be creating a '''TV-B-Gone''' remote control out of an '''Arduino''' you can take home with you.

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 in the huge '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given twice
(both identical):
   Day 2: 22-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm
   Day 3: 23-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm

event.title: Regio Mediation
event.description: Streitigkeiten, die sich schon tiefer in einen Verein eingetreten haben oder sogar mit Machtgefällen behaftet sind, sind nicht einfach aus der Welt zu schaffen und können eine gute Vereinsarbeit über lange Zeit lähmen. Wir glauben, um diese Probleme zu lösen, könnenn uns die Techniken der Mediation weiterhelfen. Wir vermuten außerdem, dass schon viel Erfahrung im CCC und seinen Mitgliedern schlummert und wollen euch einladen mit uns Idee noch weiter auszuarbeiten.

event.title: Freedom to go - an interactive workshop from An- to F- to G-Droid
event.subtitle: about:sessions
event.description: An interactive workshop to present the Free Software App repository called F-Droid and the outstanding functionalities of its clients called F-Droid and G-Droid. After that we discover the best (imho!) Android-based Free Software apps including methods of anonymization and encryption - and you will have the possibility to present your personal favorite Free Software app as well.

event.title: Global Climate Strike: exchange of ideas and experiences about organizing strikes and demonstrations
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: The climate crisis is an emergency but we’re not acting like it. Especially in political organizations like the Chaos Community this topic has to be more present, more visible. Our hotter planet is already hurting millions of people. We are not only in one of the best positions to provide technology for change, but we also should show that we belong to the people behind the movements like Fridays For Future or Global Climate Strike.

event.title: Club culture against the monopoly of Facebook
event.description: Reclaim Club Culture goes Feediverse, we want to learn about alternatives to facebook: We need a platform that includes social multimedia feeds and most importantly: a calendar for mobilization/invitation. event.title: Fair Ticket Sales on a Capitalist World
event.subtitle: Welcome to capitalism where prices regulate the differences between deman and supply, or do they?
event.description: In this open discussion we will discuss solutions taken by organizations to address ticket sales at fair prices when demand significantly outgrows supply

event.title: Advanced web tracking methods
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: Advanced browser tracking techniques have developed over the last decade that allow remote sites to leverage the increasingly feature-rich web to track users without their knowledge or consent. Not only are distinct visits across sites logged via techniques such as browser fingerprinting, sites that handle our most intimate details are monitoring our behavior on pages and handing that information to third parties with little to no regard to our privacy. This will cover some of those advanced techniques that have emerged, and how to protect yourself against pervasive web tracking.

event.title: Bandwidth Matters, Information controls in a conflict state in India
event.description: What does information controls look like in conflict states of India? How does indias surveillance apparatus further intensify the information controls in conflict areas? How does this affect the everyday life of people esp women living and promoting peace in these regions?

event.subtitle: Hacksession
event.description: the decentralisation hackathon

event.title: Decentrathon
event.subtitle: Pitches
event.description: the decentralisation hackathon

event.title: Discussion on privacy-friendly green policies in the European Union
event.subtitle: about:sessions
event.description: How can we combine environmental issues with privacy-friendly solutions? Knowing that privacy comes at a cost of efficiency, what should the red lines be in the privacy VS environment debate? Is the fight for privacy in green policy the beginning of the end for surveillance capitalism?

event.title: How to shape a responsible world?
event.subtitle: Follow up
event.description: As activists we seek for a fundamental change in this world towards a fair and responsible society. The invited groups will give their analysis of the problems and present their work. Together we will identify questions or common projects we will work on in the follow-up workshops.

event.title: Illegal content online – Bringing rights-based solutions to the EU table
event.subtitle: about:stage
event.description: EDRi proposes a political workshop to stress-test human rights-based solutions to ongoing debates in EU Brussels bubble: platforms' responsibilities towards illegal content online, prosecution of online crimes and conditions for law enforcement to access online evidence.

event.title: Ink!: Write Wasm smart contracts with Rust
event.description: A comprehensive, end-to-end tutorial for building an ERC20 token using Parity Substrate and ink! - build on Rust and wasm

event.title: Substrate Collectibles - Build your own blockchain-backed asset exchange
event.subtitle: Second Iteration
event.description: This workshop will take you through building your own collectibles blockchain - think "CryptoKitties" - using Substrate, Rust and WebAssembly.

event.title: ArduTouch music synthesizer
event.description:
''Learn to solder together a cool, powerful music synthesizer,
       and learn to make cool music, sound, and noise!''

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 at the '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given:
   Day 4: 30-Dec, 1pm - 4pm

event.title: Bristlebots for kids!
event.subtitle: Day 4
event.description: DE/EN/FI Build a little electronic insect robot from a toothbrush and a motor

event.title: Icibici
event.description: build a simple brain-computer interface for €20

event.title: Learn To Solder
event.subtitle: Day 4
event.description:
Learn to Solder! A large variety of way cool kits are available, all designed for total beginners to complete successfully -- and intriguing enough for the total hardware geek.

'''''This ongoing workshop will be happening concurrently with lots of other way cool workshops at the Hardware Hacking Area! All day & all night, throughout all of CCCamp2019.'''''

event.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners - electronic kitten EXPERIMENTAL WORKSHOP
event.subtitle: EXPERIMENTAL Day 4 - 17:30
event.description: Experimental new workshop - Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building an electronic touch-activated purring kitten. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 6 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

event.title: Beer Tasting
event.subtitle: 2nd round of Beer Tasting (what‘s left from 1st round)
event.description: Taste a variety of beers from Franconia

event.title: CoderDojo
event.subtitle: CoderDojo
event.description: CoderDojo - between 12 and 18 years old yourh people

event.title: HFOS - The Hackerfleet Operating System
event.subtitle: HFOS@c-base
event.description: HFOS is the opensource vessel computer system

event.title: Pentagame
event.description: New abstract board game explained and played

event.title: Digital Self-Defense Workshop
event.subtitle: E-Mail Encryption
event.description: Learn about the basics of practical cryptography and privacy enhancing measures for your digital devices in the spirit of a CryptoParty.

event.title: Feierliche Verlesung des gesammelten Ärgers
event.description: Solemn reading of the collected anger

event.title: Märchenstunde (für Erwachsene)
event.subtitle: Computerge- schichte und Frauen*: letzter Teil, die Gegenwart, was ist da los und was soll das

event.title: RSA Verschlüsselung selbst rechnen
event.description: Die (gar nicht so schwere) Mathematik hinter RSA

event.title: SocialTech
event.subtitle: SocialTech #2
event.description: Workshop: Accessibility and Inclusion - Hacking everyday communication practices to change the world.

event.title: Free Software Song sing-along
event.subtitle: ad-hoc choir
event.description: Everyday at 19:30 in the Cluster about:freedom we invite you to sing together the Free Software song; We have the lyrics and a conductor. Simply come, bring your hacker buddies and your voice and maybe an instrument and we form an ad-hoc choir and sing out loud our love for Free Software!

event.title: GOC
event.subtitle: Destillation
event.description: Gin Operation Center

event.title: Graphics with LaTeX
event.description: introduction into generating graphics with LaTeX

event.title: How to get ordinary people using Jekyll, LaTeX, Gitlab CI and other magic
event.description: How to set up a Gitlab project to automatically generate a Website and PDFs from the same source and make normal people use it...

event.title: Hacker Coop Genossenschaft
event.description: Hacker eG Meetup

event.title: Hackerspaces.org meetup
event.description: an opportunity to get involved and catch up with the hackerspaces.org community

event.title: Permaculture for hackers
event.description: a presentation and discussion about how hackerculture can be mixed with permaculture and the benefits of this union

event.title: Let's hack words!
event.description: Let's hack words is a session for everyone, who wants to explore creative writing, build worlds and lets characters dive into adventures. Or - for a start - just wants to get rid of hacker's block.

event.title: Oscilloscope Music Workshop
event.subtitle: Open Lab
event.description: Open lab on how to create music that generates images and animations when graphed in x/y mode

event.title: Postapokalyptic jewellery
event.subtitle: scrap tinkering - schrottbasteln
event.description: living in the postapocalypse and noticing the beauty of relicts of human civilisation, we start to adorn and grace ourselves with it. the workshop offers to create more or less pretty jewellery things out of a big collection of found objects. bring your own nuggets or choose from provided material. there will be a donation box as sad enough the apocalypse didn't make capitalism history.

event.title: SumoRobot programming
event.subtitle: Day 4 evening
event.description: You will be able to write your awesome algorithm and get a blast on the SumoRobot match.
